column4: I have a DNS problem I was hoping someone could help me out with.
what knida of dns problem?

I have a Ubuntu box acting as a firewall/router for my internal network and the two windows boxes I have hooked up to it work just fine but DNS can't resolve on the two bsd boxes I have hooked up.  I'm able to ssh to all boxes no problem.  Any ideas?
rpgsim: one sec
route -n showing your default gateway?
I can't ping any outside ips, and the resolv.conf has the nameservers for my isp listed.
rpg: yes, I can ping and ssh to all boxes on my internal network
rpg: see that's the thing, I'm pretty sure it's my firewall on ubuntu as I've hooked up the bsd boxes directly to my cable modem and it works no problem.
wbhc : and you checked your default gateway?
default gateway?
does your firewall log denials
rpg: not sure how to check for static routes.  I was using webmin to setup iptables but then switched to firestarter.
bsd it is netstat -rn
that should show you default gateway
rpg: on the ubuntu box the default gateway shows my isp ip.
http://www.cyberciti.biz/faq/freebsd-setup-default-routing-with-route-command/
need to know the routing table for your bsd's that are behind your ubuntu firwall
rpg: I think the rules are set to forward all internal network traffic.  let me check that faq that was just posted for me. brb
hate to ask but your interfaces are up on your bsd as well, ifconfig -a
sorry missed that
& rgp: Thanks! using the netstat command I saw that my default gateway was set to 192.168.0.0 instead of 192.168.0.1  I fixed it and now it works.  Thanks!
